snippet.title: A Poetic Epiphany: Explorations of Aesthetic Forms of Representation
snippet.description:
* A Poetic Epiphany: Explorations of Aesthetic Forms of Representation (Citations: 1)
Alexandra L. Adame, Larry M. Leitner, Roger M. Knudson
Alternative forms of representation, such as poetry, are becoming more widely used by qualitative researchers in disciplines such as anthropology, sociology, and psychology. Aesthetic forms of representation highlight the co-constructed nature of the research project, and in this article we will discuss how they can facilitate creative explorations of lived experience in qualitative research. We begin with an example ...
Journal: Qualitative Research in Psychology , vol. 8, no. 4, pp. 370-379, 2011

snippet.title: Self-disclosure in computer-mediated communication: The role of self-awareness and visual anonymity
snippet.description:
* Self-disclosure in computer-mediated communication: The role of self-awareness and visual anonymity (Citations: 187)
Adam N. Joinson
Three studies examined the notion that computer-mediated communication (CMC) can be charac- terised by high levels of self-disclosure. In Study One, significantly higher levels of spontaneous self- disclosure were found in computer-mediated compared to face-to-face discussions. Study Two examined the role of visual anonymity in encouraging self-disclosure during CMC. Visually anonymous participants disclosed significantly ...
Journal: European Journal of Social Psychology - EUR J SOC PSYCHOL , vol. 31, no. 2, pp. 177-192, 2001

snippet.title: Applying Agile MethodstoWeapon/Weapon-Related Software
snippet.description:
* Applying Agile MethodstoWeapon/Weapon-Related Software
D Adams, M Armendariz, M Blackledge, F Campbell, M Cloninger, L Cox, J Davis, M Elliott, K Granger, S Hans, C Kuhn, M Lacknerhttp://academic.research.microsoft.com/io.ashx?type=5&id=60573923&selfId1=-1&selfId2=-1&maxNumber=12&query=Adam rogers music
This white paper provides information and guidance to the Department of Energy (DOE) sites on Agile software development methods and the impact of their application on weapon/weapon-related software development. The purpose of this white paper is to provide an overview of Agile methods, examine the accepted interpretations/uses/practices of these methodologies, and discuss the applicability of Agile ...
Published in 2007.
